website_summaries.verdict: This tent brings convenience to your backpacking excursions because it's easy to carry and set up.
pros: Spacious dome-shaped design can fit 2 occupants, yet it's reasonably lightweight and won't bog you down on your adventures
Setup is extremely easy, even for novice campers and backpackers
Polyester material is designed to be used for 3-season camping but provides decent warmth in cold temperatures
Storage pockets create space for essential items
cons: it can get stuffy in this tent on humid nights
The material of the storage bag and floor is on the thin side

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on the Appalachian Trail!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son when he did the Appalachian Trail in 2016. He used a hammock for 4 of the mths but as it got colder he wanted to be more out of wind. He said it was awesome! He finished the whole trail in less than 6 mths! no issues with it! He is going to head out to do part of the trail again in 2017 and taking his tent!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent At a Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm going into my third backpacking season with this tent, and I'm in love. This is, hands down, the best bang for your buck. This thing has gotten me through intense winds and rainstorms. It has been in the mountains and in the middle of the Grand Canyon. I don't use a footprint, and I ditch the bag it came in to shave some weight. The stakes are decent and don't require replacement. The weight is amazing for what you pay, and the quality is there, as well. I plan on buying this model in other sizes so I can take my dogs or husband with me. I currently own the 1P.
customer_reviews.author: SKRUC

customer_reviews.title: This tent is well designed and is what I hoped ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent is well designed and is what I hoped it would be. Caution: be sure to set it up before you take it to the woods. Mine had two errors; one snap link was missing and another one was the wrong size! Customer service is confusing to reach (call by phone, do not try the e-mail contact) when using the phone the representatives clearly speak English and are empowered to "make it right" my tent could have been returned via Amazon Prime but choose to return it to the Kelty repair facility with a two to three week turnaround.
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a couple of pounds heavier than some competitors, but cost hundreds less. Only the top of the tent is mesh and provides more coverage during cold temps. The tent stayed dry during a snow storm and stood solid. There was a few condensation drops at the top of the tent by morning, but otherwise the tent remains dry inside. The tent sets up in minutes and packs tight in a backpack; without the tent bag. I think the high quality material of this tried and true tent technology adds weight to tents costing even $500 more.
customer_reviews.author: powershopper1

customer_reviews.title: I like the tent
customer_reviews.text: I like the tent. It is rather small and might not be suitable for long people, it is also pretty narrow. But it is light and small when packed. One of the nights it was raining (it was not downpour, but I would say it was pretty heavy rain) and we staid dry inside. One of the nights was in desert with the strong wind during the night. The tent withstood, but all the warmth was blown away, so it wasn't the best night. But we do not plan to have any nights in deserts in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kelty Salida (2 person) Camping and Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very easy to set up. No more than 5 minutes and it’s ready to go. You’ll honestly spend more time finding the right spot to setup and get the stuff out of the bag, than actually setting up the tent. Perfect for 1 person, with extra space, or an adult with child. Two adults would be a bit cramped in the 2 person version. It’s packs up very small, and is very light. Under or very close to 4 pounds if you’re watching weight. I use it monthly to go on camp outs with my son in Boy Scouts and it’s handles rain, sun, wind, cold weather, whatever with no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: chuckntx

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: My first backpacking tent. Went on a 2-day trip. I appreciate that this tent was fairly light as I had to backpack everything to the campsite. Also, it was simple to set up. Nice idea having the color-coded straps. The temp only dropped to 60, so being cold was never a concern but it was noticeably warmer in the tent than outside in the morning. It's apparent to me that if you wish to lay out some equipment, a two-man tent is the right size for one person. For example, I preferred to keep my pack inside. There would not be room in a single person tent.
customer_reviews.author: MChase

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking tent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when I am backpacking and cannot lug a bigger tent around. It goes up very easily, is extremely sturdy, and kept me dry when it rained. I am not a gear expert when it comes to tents, but this one really worked well for me (I did bring a small tarp to act as a footprint to protect the bottom).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best for this price range
customer_reviews.text: The detail of design is impressive. The bar is high for Kelty products overall, and the same detail is brought to this affordable, trusted, 1.5 man tent. Enough for myself, a dog, and gear. Two people is a spoon, but will work. Pros: Colorway is not too loud, but still bright enough for good morale. Stitching, materials, waterproofing, zippers, poles, stakes, are quality for it's range Simple, good size, 2 pole, damn near 4 season with a good footprint. Cons: Not a fan of the square bag. The tub is not as waterproof as I want, still better than most Light color stains easily
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy DiPilato

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for most needs
customer_reviews.text: Good tent that I carried for the first 300 miles of the Appalachian trail through Maine. Worked well but was a little heavier than the Big Agnes so I opted for lighter. I like the headroom in this over the BA and the ability to put my head on either end (sloping ground). The vestibule is good enough for 1 pack but would be sporty for 2. Easy to set up and pack. Quality tent. Negatives are the small pockets and lack of loft.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, not sure it can be beat. Compared to the best of the best, a Hillaberg, not bad at all. *The tent is small for two but perfect for one. Will be tight for someone 6 feet or taller. *Ventillation, especially in the rain, is not as good as other more expensive Kelty's, so it is essential that all the guy lines be installed and used (That Kelty only provides 4 instead of the needed 7 lines and its pegs is a shame, so you will need to buy 3 extra lines and pegs) *Poles are on the flimsy side so I wouldn't recommend this tent for very harsh weather (30+ MPH)
customer_reviews.author: EJTV

customer_reviews.title: Good for motorcycle touring
customer_reviews.text: This is a great one-person tent, as long as you aren't super tall. For me the selling point was the weight and size. It's fairly light, which is good, and the tent poles are short when they fold up. I needed a tent that when folded up would fit into my saddlebag on my motorcycle, and this is one of the few that would.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Paul Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Kept us warm and safe in Yellowstone backcountry
customer_reviews.text: I've used this guy now on a few trips in California, Montana, and South Dakota. It's lightweight, keeps you dry, and keeps you warm. It's tight in here for two people, but the saved pack space can be worth it. Just a warning, the stakes are not as sturdy as they look. I'd be careful before putting your foot on them as they might bend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Easy, fast setup
customer_reviews.text: Spent a few nights out in the woods in North Carolina and a friends backyard in NJ. Easy, fast setup, quick pack. Way light, (I'm not climbing K2 this season). Good bug resistance. As with most of these types of tents the stakes are flimsy, but do the job in regular soil. If it's not windy you don't even have to stake it down. But, you really do need to string out the 'porch' flap and the hood to reduce condensation.
customer_reviews.author: G. Feldner

customer_reviews.title: This tent is great for the minimalist and for bike touring
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great for the minimalist and for bike touring. Not only is it easy to set up, it comes with non-standard size aluminum tent poles that are very compact compared to others. The storage bag that it comes with is not really a necessity. It packs flat which may be useful in some cases. I rolled up the tent and fly together and put a strap around it to secure it firmly and put a velcro strap around the tent poles to keep them secure. This all fit neatly, including tent poles, into my Ortlieb Bike Packer Plus Panniers. The packed tent would probably work well in a backpack too if you're good at organizing your gear. RB
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice tent
customer_reviews.text: easy to set up, only issue as with all tents I have ever owned, the shock cord is never strong enough and broke on one pole after 5 setups/take downs. Other than that love it, you even have a chance of getting it back in the factory storage bag after use which is so-unlike any other tent on the market these days.
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW HALLOCK

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent because I wanted something of a little higher quality for a camping/mountain climb trip I was taking in the High Peaks region of the Adirondacks. I found this tent was very easy to set up and take down and the materials were of much higher quality that your average store brand tents. More than enough room for just myself but I don't think I would push the envelope and call it a 2 person tent.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Reed

customer_reviews.title: My favorite tent of all time
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite tent of all time. I go backpacking every month of the year: rain, shine, snow, or ice. This tent is long enough for a grown man to stretch out in and have just enough room for your pack, too. The vestibule is perfect for boots or cooking breakfast. No water can get in this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Very good value tent
customer_reviews.text: My brother and I both took one of these tents to Oshkosh. They are lightweight and easy to set up. The morning dew on the tents dried out quickly in the sun. They come with convenient small bags with ties for the poles, stakes, and ties. Seemed to be very durable. The 2-man size is roomy for one person. It helped a lot to pre-spray them with mosquito repellent.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii CFI

customer_reviews.title: I went camping to the Kern River this weekend and ...
customer_reviews.text: I went camping to the Kern River this weekend and used it. The flapping was unbearable. I've used other tents before where I add the tie downs and that prevents or significant reduces flapping... no matter what I did the flapping was non-stop; really wish that I would've taken duct-tape :(
customer_reviews.author: Elmo Lover

customer_reviews.title: Torrential rains and hail all night--not a drop of water made it in. This is a fantastic tent. Two men might have to spoon.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent! A little small for two adult men (unless they like to spoon), but it's great for my 12-year-old son and me. Last month we camped at 12,000 feet--huge thunderstorm, hail, lightning (very, very frightening), torrential rains, and this little tent, with no footprint or groundcloth did lot leak a drop. Plus it's so lightweight Highly recommended/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fave camping purchase
customer_reviews.text: 2 person tent: I do a lot of solo camping and love how fast it is for me to get this tent up in the rain or dark. Also the compact bag and clip is a great feature for kayak/travel. I haves used this tent in rural Alaska, windy Flatlands in the Midwest, & in Maine for a week long kayak trip....loved it! little features like the mesh pockets are cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Clara Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Great tent with a great price.
customer_reviews.text: The tent is easy to set up. It rained heavily the first night I used it and not a drop got in the tent. Very light. The pole design works flawlessly. Easy to pick up and move. Vestibule is a great size. Was able to make coffee in the morning in the vestibule while raining. Can't say enough great things about the kelty tent. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan kruse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this tent for scouting and some backpacking. Love the easy setup, as well as the room inside. I'm 6' and had no problems fitting myself and all my gear in this thing. Tent has good air flow when staked out, and was easy to pack away in the included stuff sack/roll bag. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Techneck

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and fast to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Kelty ridgeline 4 person tent for years, so when looking for a lighter smaller tent I wanted to check out a kelty tent again. The Salida 2 person was great for person. Just enough room for me and my gear (I am six feet, 200 lbs). The pros of this tent is it super easy and fast to set up. I also like the bag it comes with for packing up and storing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dittman

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent. Works well for one adult and ok for and adult and child. There's not much room in the vestibule, but enough to store a small bit of gear. The build quality seems to be top notch. Have used this on several scout campouts and very happy with it. Extremely easy to setup and take down. Update...been using this for about a year now and still loving it! Have been through a couple of campouts with all night rains and staid dry all night.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Colorado approved
customer_reviews.text: this tent is a reasonable weight, and compact enough for someone willing to practice efficient backpack packing. In one of the coldest springs the Colorado Rockies has seen in quite a while, the tent was more than satisfactory. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on about 6 hiking trips so far. Every time, people are jealous that mine is such a perfect size and sets up in like 4 minutes. I'm 5'10" and this fits me and my essential pack items perfectly. Too small for 2 people I think unless it's summer and you don't need anything else with you inside. Fits my rollout pad perfectly. Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent for a week of back country camping in Yellowstone. After a long day of hiking it was a relief to have the tent set up in a few minutes without any frustration. Side entry is superior to end entry for ease of access. The design of the rainfly allowed me to keep my pack under cover from the dew and light rain I encountered.
customer_reviews.author: dxpope

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact poles - felt spacious inside (for 1 person)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old (20+ year old) North Face Tadpole 3 tent. That tent is actually in great condition & has kept up for years with me, but it was time for a replacement. Very pleased with this tent as the poles are compact, the fabric lightweight, the clip system is easy and sets up in minutes. Had to by the groundcloth separately and i would recommend having one to protect your tent.
customer_reviews.author: SamirB

customer_reviews.title: Too delicate of a tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tent, but I wouldn’t recommend it. We have owned it for about 1 year ago. It has maybe been used it 10 times. It has a leak in the floor. (We have treated it well and it shouldn’t have developed a leak in the floor)
customer_reviews.author: Td1179

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on the Appalachian Trail in May. This tent is great. Lightweight and easy setup. The extra height over most 1person tents is helpful to me. At 6'1" I had plenty of room. With my sleeping pad and bag I still had room to stick my backpack next to my feet. I used it one night during a steady rain and remained nice and dry. The only issue that I have is that the 2 person tent is less than 1 lb heavier with much more room. I also have the grand mesa 2 person and have similar great results.
customer_reviews.author: axle

customer_reviews.title: Works great and make setup and take down a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this guy a few days ago on a camping trip. Works great and make setup and take down a breeze. I do wish that there were some sort of mesh pockets on the inside to hold my wallet and keys and such but other than that the tent held two people with some (although only a little ) room for our boots and some room in between
customer_reviews.author: Camereon McCartney

customer_reviews.title: A good choice for taller campers
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" and the main goal was finding a light tent I could carry in a pack and not have my head sticking out one end. In my bag with big feet pointing up, I fit with an inch or two to spare-the sides come up at an angle, so while the floor is plenty long the length at 8-12" off the floor is a little less. I would say 2 of me in the tent would have been too close unless I was really in love with myself! But for 1 it was great, I kept my pack inside as I was in the Oregon coastal rainforest and I stayed dry at night for several days of rain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Tudor

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent the week before going on a backpacking trip in Yosemite. This tent is exactly what I was looking for. It is lightweight and fits perfect in the bottom of my 85L backpack. It's only about 4 inches thick when sitting on the bottom of the bag. Easily set up by one person in 5-person. The only thing I wish it came with was a footprint but that's just picky. BUY WITH CONFIDENCE.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna G

customer_reviews.title: The square packaging isn't ideal for putting in the backpack but having a sturdy 4 person tent for less than $200 and under ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable value for a family that backpacks. Fit al 4 with some wiggle room on our 3 day adventure on Snoqualmie Pass. It braved a 10hr wind and rain storm and we were 100% dry inside. The square packaging isn't ideal for putting in the backpack but having a sturdy 4 person tent for less than $200 and under 10lbs!! (get the footprint to protect it or cut your own)
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent for the price. It is roomy enough for two people with inflatable sleeping pads to sleep comfortable. The first night I used it, there was heavy rain throughout the night. We stayed completely dry while our friends in more expensive tents had issues with moisture. I just wish it came with a footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: But man is it a beautiful size and design for one
customer_reviews.text: The tent is exactly what they say. Bullet proof but is about a pound and 1/2 too heavy for a solo tent and with one side door is a pain for two people during potty times. But man is it a beautiful size and design for one. If you have pack room and can handle the weight, you will live like a king on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Held up to 6" of wet/heavy snow!
customer_reviews.text: Took this tent backpacking this past week in Yellowstone. Woke up Tuesday morning to six inches of heavy, wet snow. The tent held up beautifully to the weight of it and we remained nice and dry. Our packs/gear also stayed nice and dry under the flap. There are probably lighter tents out there but this worked out amazingly and was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: ermiba

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong tent and it is very easy to assemble. I took it to Iceland and it provided me four nice nights because it sustained the strong wind in iceland! It is a really nice and lightweight tent
customer_reviews.author: Angustu

customer_reviews.title: Mixed up order
customer_reviews.text: This probably a great tent. But it isn't what I received. I bought this tent in May at the start of the season. I haven't been able to use the tent until now. It was packaged in a Salida 2 bag. However the Tent inside was a Grand Mesa 2. What's worse is the fly is for the Salida 2 with a side opening but the tent body has a front opening. So posted off. I'm glad it didn't rain on my first trip.... I also have a Salida 2 footprint that kinda worked... UPDATE: While Amazon was completely unhelpful. Kelty customer service was amazing. They swapped out my tent and I'm back in business.
customer_reviews.author: William Etson

customer_reviews.title: '2 Man' Is Just Not True
customer_reviews.text: This tent is rated as 2 man. I'd like to see 2 men fit in this tent - actually, no, I wouldn't. My Wife, who's 5 foot and my daughter who' 4 foot, cannot sleep in this tent, together. Had to buy another tent. This one just collects dust now.
customer_reviews.author: paulfvan

customer_reviews.title: You’ll stay dry!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 14 days straight, with 2 adults. It kept us dry and bug free for the whole trip. Had 3 nights of torrential down pours (yup those red cell storms) and stayed dry, even with a river running under the tent. Had no issues in 25 mph of winds, only some minor flapping which was because of set up issues due to terrain, not the tent. Everything worked great for the whole trip.
customer_reviews.author: Tammie

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, quality, bit small for 2 man.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, did well in 2 days of fairly steady rain. A bit on the small side for 2 man. The poles are amazing and magnetically pretty much place themselves. Quality seems decent. I like the vestibule between the tent and rainfly. Enough space for ice chest and room to cook esbit stove and is protected on rainy day.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry  Almond

customer_reviews.title: A lot of tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I just finished my second camping weekend in this tent. This weekend will be remembered for the remnants of Hurricane Delta passing through my area. In spite of the fact that the tent pads were designed to drain, it was raining hard enough that they did not, so the tent was sitting in water (like 2.5 inches of water) on the second morning. I was massively impressed that the inside of the tent did not allow water through. Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Flimsie material. not impressed
customer_reviews.text: The main gripe I have is my rainfly wouldn't stay attached because. The clip that holds it on was one size bigger than the other three. It is sewn on and is not a quick easy fix! Why you test your gear out at home! Also compared two my alps mountaineering tent the material is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: jeff kus

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, light and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: First tent I've ever purchased and very pleased with it. Used it for car camping with my husband, fit an REI queen air mattress inside with a bit of room to spare. Easy to set up and take down. Held up well during 36 mph winds in monument valley plus kept the sand and bugs out.
customer_reviews.author: B.G.

customer_reviews.title: not ground breaking design BUT a great value compared with other tents costing at least twice ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the lightest tent, not the roomiest tent, not ground breaking design BUT a great value compared with other tents costing at least twice as much. I've had this for a year and don't regret the purchase at all. To avoid condensation use the included cords to tie out the bottom of the rain fly. Best used for 1 person if your gear goes inside. Very quick and easy to set up. Only drawback is no air vent in the top to give better ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Light, Durable< Roomy, Quick Drying Great Quality For the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Light, Durable, Fast Setup tear down, Roomy for 1 person and a pack. I don't know how this is considered a 2 person tent especially if you are over 6' tall and have a large pack. Its ideal if your a single hiker because it has just enough room for a pack and sleeping. Its a durable quick drying tent and ideal for extended thru hikes. For the price this is a great little tent.
customer_reviews.author: BlueiSwim

customer_reviews.title: Love! Set up took maybe 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Love! Set up took maybe 5 minutes, and then I got to have a beer while I watched my camp neighbors struggle with theirs. Rain cover did an excellent job of keeping me dry during a light thunderstorm. Perfect for myself and my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: I love the tent
customer_reviews.text: I love the tent! fit 2 tall people perfectly with room inside which is what i got it for. Make sure to pay attention to how it orignally was folded!!! its a little hard to get it back to being compact.. not a big deal at all tho.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R. Fikse

customer_reviews.title: Very good tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good tent for the price. I’m 6’2” and have been using it on the AT. With most, if not all tents, there is condensation on the inside under wet conditions. But you can’t get around that with some $600 tents.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: This tent is awesome. It's really light
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome. It's really light, holds up to wind really well. It warms up quick when the cover is on. The only downside is the bag it comes in doesn't pack up very small. This is good though, as it makes it easy to put back into the bag, but it takes up quite a bit of space in a pack. This could be taken care of easily with a compression bag or a strap. Overall, it's a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Ross D

customer_reviews.title: Buy one you won't be sorry !
customer_reviews.text: Pro: In my humble opinion this is the perfect budget backpacking tent. Lightweight, easy to assemble, fantastic ventilation, roomy and has held up to everything I've exposed it to! Great price,great value, fantastic tent. Con: Ground sheet not included.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Sarc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent to do motorcycle camping trips. I was debating between this model or their tn2 model and very happy I went with the salida. First time I used it I set a timer from taking it out of the packaging to set up was only 4minutes and 45 seconds. Easiest tent I’ve ever set up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet small tent for two!
customer_reviews.text: Deserves 5 stars, but give it four to distinguish from all the 5 star fake reviews. Great small tent, and what a price! Super easy set up, used for backpacking for two. No complaints whatsoever, another great Kelty wonder.
customer_reviews.author: Menard LaPue

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price point! Most negative reviews are about the space, this is a two person tent. That doesn’t mean 2 people plus some gear. You will be close to your camping buddy. Plan ahead and get a larger one if you need it. I’m using it for myself and gear so I have plenty of room. It’s super easy to set up. I haven’t used it outside yet so I’m not sure how it will hold up in harsh weather but it seems like a good choice for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Read the specifications carefully
customer_reviews.text: This tent was quite large even folded up and difficult to attach to the backpack. The fly was not the same size as the tent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bang for buck.
customer_reviews.text: Initial review: light, compact and sturdy. Just took this to my local summit (10,000ft) and it held well against wind gust that were around 20-30mph all night. Kept cold wind out while staying ventilated. Did not use tarp. Set up is easy, only takes about 5 minutes. So far, will recommend. Will update. Update: have used this about 10 times, still in good condition. Very light weight & all.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for 3 seasons.
customer_reviews.text: Great 1 man tent! I spent a few days with this tent in freezing weather and the rain fly really helps keep the warmth in. I'm 6'2" and still fit inside. If you're in warmer weather, you should leave the rainfly off or partially unzipped.
customer_reviews.author: Dane P.

customer_reviews.title: I just started using it so take this with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I just started using it so take this with a grain of salt but it is humid inside and hard to get a breeze going through the tent with the fly on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a roadtrip. Stayed dry through 3 solid days of rain at yellowstone and was able to fold up and fit back in its compact bag. Setup is simple tear down is quick overall great tent. Fit 3 teenagers and a 90lb lab with gear. Salida 4.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Mihalyi

customer_reviews.title: Price a bit high
customer_reviews.text: I like the light weight and looks like a good quality. I haven't tested and returned it because received an on sale one from another brand and I am happy with the price and quality. This tent price is a but high for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Functional tent. Nice and light. I'm not a big fan of the overall design. The fly is too close to the tent and moisture ends up sticking them together at times. There was another Kelty model I was looking at and I think I would have liked that one better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ball

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Did a test run in my living room to check it out but I needn't have worried; it was a cinch to put up at the camp site, even with limited light. I brushed some iridescent paint on the fly cords and tent pegs, being careful not to get any on the tent material, and that made it much easier to maneuver around the area by firelight without concern for tripping over lines. It rained moderately during one night, no water at all. Would recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: jill dickson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value,
customer_reviews.text: Love the tent, easy set up and is roomy enough for me, my gear and my Pug. Given the price it is very good value from a reputable manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tent 3 times so far, 2 of which were in the rain. It proved to be quite waterproof! It is very quick and easy to set up and the rain fly clips on quickly and easily. It is around 7 lbs which for a 4 person tent in this price range is pretty lightweight. I backpack with it. I bought a compression sack for it to cut down on size.
customer_reviews.author: Sj Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent. Good size tent, good amount of venting. Fits us 2 and our 2 dogs (1 large, 1 medium) well. Very pretty design and super easy to set up. Can set up in less than 10 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Traps moisture inside
customer_reviews.text: Despite not raining the tent was wet on the inside. The conditions were misty, but having to keep a roll of paper towels with you on the inside seems like a big downside.
customer_reviews.author: erebos

customer_reviews.title: Shape is weird for packing
customer_reviews.text: Wish it wasn’t square and packed differently. Going to stuff it myself but wish it came like that already for packing reasons
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Sansevere

customer_reviews.title: Kelty Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very light, very simple and quick to set up. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it is very small for 2 people. I'm 5'4 and my wife is 5'1. We are not tall or wide. We are small people. The length was fine, but side by side it's a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: TinyRhino

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Easy to carry and assemble. I used it with my small dog backpacking a few nights and it was great. Haven't tested it in rain but it looks like it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Benstead

customer_reviews.title: Great product. We purchase this tent to do backpacking ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We purchase this tent to do backpacking trips with my family (we're 4), and the tent is great. Very spacious and not too heavy. So easy to put together. We have yet to try it on harsher conditions (more cold and rain).
customer_reviews.author: KPF2017

customer_reviews.title: Air flow
customer_reviews.text: We are avid campers I love Kelly and had one before. I don’t like how it’s not as compact as my last Kelty. It also does not have good air flow when raining. Would be nice to have window canopy’s. It’s very with rain guard. Needs more air flow
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best 2P tent
customer_reviews.text: I tried several top-line 2P tents (MSR, NF, etc.) and this is by far the best as measured by (1) sturdiness to harsh weather and (2) comfort/space/weight. That's about the only criteria I use.
customer_reviews.author: GLW

customer_reviews.title: Not a 2 person tent..
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a 2 adult person tent.. 1 adult comfortably. 2 if u want to lay on top of each other.. also this will NOT fit a queen size air mattress like other people have said..
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed there is no foot print available. Returned it
customer_reviews.text: There is not a foot print available for this tent
customer_reviews.author: Erika Tindel

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent! I bought this tent to take on the AT in the spring of 2016. I am a big man, 6'2" and 300#. I fit easily in this tent, with room for my pack (Kelty Coyote 80) Quick set up, tear down. packs well. I am upgrading the stakes though.
customer_reviews.author: paul godbout

customer_reviews.title: Solid tent and great value.
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of Kelty tents, this is my 3rd one (all for different purposes). This isn't the lightest backpacking tent, but it is a good value and it has performed well on the couple of trips it has been taken on. It keeps you dry and has plenty of room for keeping your gear dry either in the tent or vestibule. I personally use this for 1 person and can't speak to using it for 2 people.
customer_reviews.author: D. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Best tent. Used it for years on the AT. Still using it yearly. Hopefully, for a few more years.
customer_reviews.author: Victor R. Laboy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size with great features.
customer_reviews.text: I motorcycle-camped with a larger Kelty Gunnison tent and liked all the features, but purchased this 2-person tent for it's reduced storage size. It's a super tent with all the helpful features of the larger Kelty. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: RJW

customer_reviews.title: Great little backpacking tent on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Great little backpacking tent on a budget! I've taken this on several day solo backpacking trips and loved it. Only thing I wish was different is if there were vents at the top of the rain fly. Otherwise excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent. I had to purchase the bottom mat separately. Easy to assemble, has little pockets inside the tent on the corners.
customer_reviews.author: jlu

customer_reviews.title: Great Packing Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great for packing in when hunting or camping, or whatever you may be doing. I’ve only gone hunting and camping so far.
customer_reviews.author: A.J

customer_reviews.title: The perfect tent for the rainy tropics
customer_reviews.text: I live and camp out in El Salvador, Central America. In this country, when ir rains, it rains a lot! Never had a problem with the water proofing. After a campout a few days back every other tent got wet Inside, not mine. I can assure you that the tent has excellent water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto ruiz

customer_reviews.title: This tent is great. I took it camping in Death Valley with ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great. I took it camping in Death Valley with my friend and our two dogs and everyone fit nicely. It's also super light. If you are planning to take it backpacking though, I would recommend having one person carry the rain fly and footprint/tarp, and another carry the tent because it is a little bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good Price & Solid Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent mainly for my backpacking trip to Havasupai. Lightweight and great for backpacking! It's enough room for 2 people and plenty of room for 1 person. Easy tent to set up. Received all parts in full upon delivery. I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: nairde

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! Took it out and it performed as expected. It lightly rained and the rain fly worked well and kept all of our gear dry. We felt like it kept us a little bit warmer than expected. You could spent a lot more for a lighter tent but when you only go out backpacking 5-7 times a year it's hard to justify. It also fit two people very comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Branch

customer_reviews.title: Great tent fast setup
customer_reviews.text: Great tent fast setup. Stays warm enough too. Light enough to go backpacking with if needed. Can fit a queen size air matress. Best suited for car camping. Or dual person hiking where you can offset the loads on each other. Cons: Requires the seperate footprint for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this tent
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this tent! super easy to set up, keeps out rain wonderfully with the fly and its just the right size for two people and their gear! The only con I would give it is that there is no privacy without the rain fly on which can be kind of hot when you don't actually need it:/
customer_reviews.author: Bmoody

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good price.
customer_reviews.text: Sets up quickly and is a little tight for two people if you plan on putting your backpack inside with you. I haven't used it on the trail yet but it seems well made and its light enough to carry all day.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, great value
customer_reviews.text: I took this tent on a roadtrip that involved setting up and breaking down our campsite many times. I'm so glad I bought this tent before the trip, because it was a breeze to set up and break down. With the rain fly, it did a great job keeping warm air inside (didn't experience any rain or severe wind). It was also surprisingly roomy, with more than enough room for me, my gear, and it was comfortable to sit up and change in.
customer_reviews.author: dorolee23

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This little tent is a great size, two average size people can fit in it for sleeping. The no see um mesh keeps all the bugs out, and in total, it's really light. Definitely a solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ghmerrill

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product! It’s perfect for one person. I haven’t taken it to backpacking yet but I love using it during car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NICE TENT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for backpacking, hunting and camping. I was the one that set it up on our last trip. Needless to say I was impressed. I have been a Kelty tent guy for a long time and will continue to be one.
customer_reviews.author: Back Country Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: A great backpacking tent! Love the size of it. I do think the heat loft should be included. I use a piece of tyvek for a lighter weight footprint. Kelty makes a solid brand. I love the pole clips and how they hug the poles. Very innovative
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up for a person who hasn't used a tent in over 15 years. Very light weight, seems like a solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RJW

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to set up, durable
customer_reviews.text: Believe the hype. This is a great 2 person tent, easy and fast to set up, lightweight, and made of quality materials. I've overnighted 3 times in it and hiked many miles with it strapped to my pack with no durability issues.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far!
customer_reviews.text: Had three thunderstorms in a weekend and this tent held up well. VERY small though - cramped with one person and a backpack and extra toiletry bag.
customer_reviews.author: writer_in_residence

customer_reviews.title: Years of use and stay dry
customer_reviews.text: I now know why this tent sells so much. Used it by myself on a sectional hike in the rain, easy up easy down. I STAYED COMPLETELY DRY. Coldest 27deg warmest 40 deg
customer_reviews.author: Chazmahall

product_meta.title: Kelty Salida Camping and Backpacking Tent, 2 Person
product_meta.description:
Style:2 PersonWinner of the 2011 Backpacker Editor's Choice Award, the updated and improved Salida is a great all-around ultralight backpacking tent. With over 10 square feet of vestibule space, a spacious interior, and higher side wall protection this tent is guaranteed to offer advanced 3-season backcountry comfort, a must have!

Seasons: 3
Number of doors: 1
Number of vestibules: 1
Number of poles: 2
Capacity: 2

Dimensions:
Minimum weight: 3 lb 14 oz / 1.76 kg
Packaged weight: 4 lb 9 oz / 2.07 kg
Floor area: 30.5 ft2 / 2.83 m2
Vestibule area: 10 ft2 / .93 m2
Length: 88 in / 224 cm
Width: 55/45 in // 140/114 cm
Height: 43 in / 109 cm
Packed size: 13 x 15 in / 33 x 38 cm
feature_bullets: Backpack-friendly compact folding poles, Gearloft loops, Color coded clip and fly attachment.Wall material: 68D Polyester, 40D No-See-Um Mesh,Floor material: 68D Nylon, 1800 mm
Roll top cube carry bag, Easy set up, Free standing, Fabric/mesh tent walls
Kelty hug clip, Easy entry D door, Internal storage pockets, Fully seam taped construction
Seasons: 3, Number of doors: 1, Number of vestibules: 1, Number of poles: 2, Capacity: 2
Floor area: 30.5 ft² / 2.83 m², Vestibule area: 10 ft² / .93 m².Wall material: 68D Polyester, 40D No-See-Um Mesh,Floor material: 68D Nylon, 1800 mm

The Salida 2 person backpacking tent is a great all-around, lightweight camping tent, the Salida 2 has over 10 sq. ft. of vestibule space and a spacious interior that offers 2 backpackers a comfortable backcountry escape
Kelty backpacking tent 2 person, ideal for your next trip up the trail, 3 season tent.
Freestanding design with DAC Pressfit poles and color-coded clip construction 2 pole design for quick and easy setup
Seasons: 3, Number of doors: 1, Number of vestibules: 1, Number of poles: 2, Capacity: 2
Dimensions: Minimum weight: 3 lb 14 oz, Packaged weight: 4 lb 9 oz, Floor area: 30.5 ft, Vestibule area: 10 ft, Tent Length: 88 in, Width: 55/45 in, Height: 43 in, Packed size: 13 x 15 in
